Post_Title: Just Messi doing the Messi things. Well I mean, what a incredible goal!!!!!!

Threads.Reply_Text:
I don't get how this is an incredible goal? Getting into the box from that run was impressive. He got in the penalty box, at which point the defenders are on egg shells not to foul him.

Then he passed the ball past the keeper, in what we used to call a 'dew goal' in my youth because it's just a bit too easy.

I know he's incredibly talented but c'mon. Myths create legends and vice versa.

Replies.Reply_Text: Itâ€™s not easy as it seems tbh, he went through one of the best defenders and at the age of 35 to pull that of against someone who is much younger is no easy feat

Nah I just think people throw around adjectives too much.

I said he was talented, but the goal was pretty simple if not borderline jammy.

People downvoting because my comment made them feel bad about this pretty simple sport, that's salty.
Hahaha the goal was simple? Why is everyone not just doing that? F off dude
What's amazing about it is DID YOU SEE HIS RUN BEFORE THE PASS??
Why are you choosing to be sad over this?

If it were that easy, you'd see it more often.

I can tell you now that it doesn't happen on a back field, rarely on a pitch and nevermind on the world's biggest stage.

If you ever played before, you'd understand the nuances and breadth of skill on display here.

Now just appreciate you're living through Messi moments while you still can.

The run and composture messi has to dribble past the defender and trick him so that he's in a position in the box where he can't be fouled, followed by the composture to pick out his team mate with a precise pass all while doing this in a wc semi final while being 35+ years old make this a great goal. Don't be tricked because he made it look incredibly simple because it isn't lmao

Mate it's football, not software engineering ðŸ˜‚

I said he was talented! But it's still not incredible. Learn to respect adjectives.

Is software engineering a sport?

Why are you being so contrarian on such a trivial thing?

How often do you see this type of goal and assist?
Watch out we got the adjective police over here

As someone who's doing his PhD in engineering I can tell you what he did was still impressive and incredible lmao football isn't that simple of a game, well maybe it is if you don't know the skills involved to do what they do on the professional level

Not sure if you're blind or just can't read but congratulations on the PhD. For the 5th time. I never said he wasn't talented. I just don't see what is impressive about a world renowned football player, attacking, and then passing back across the keeper to score a sitter.

People are allowed to say things you don't agree with and regardless of the content, I was talking about the title.
Everytime you comment on this thread or reply to someone you somehow manage to so sound more dumb each time lmao
